We offer several designated marshalling points within BC including Nanaimo, Vancouver, Kelowna, Kamloops, Williams Lake, Prince George, Smithers, and Calgary, AB.

The Head of Operations is accountable for guiding, mentoring and enabling the Mining, Processing, Maintenance and Engineering functions to provide safe, efficient and cost-effective leadership of their areas in alignment with the business strategy, objectives and goals to deliver and exceed key performance metrics for safety, health, productivity, quality and cost. In addition the Head of Operations is responsible for supporting the project execution team through informing the operational readiness plan to successfully deliver the Red Chris Block Cave to budget and schedule and in collaborating with the Manager  People and Development to define and execute the Block Cave workforce transition plan.

Facilitate cross departmental co-operation and collaboration to maximise business value; ensuring site and corporate strategic initiatives are translated into business goals.

We are seeking (1) individual for a Fly In, Fly Out opportunity working on a two weeks in, two weeks out rotation.

Accountabilities:

Demonstrates and instills an overriding commitment to safety and health, operational excellence and cost performance for value delivery. Establishes and maintains effective systems, standards and procedures that drive positive behaviours. Ensures effective communications and collaboration across all of areas of accountability, clarity of expectations and continuous review of performance measures to consistently deliver and improve upon the business objectives.

Leads, develops and maintains a business focused, high performance culture to deliver production, engineering and maintenance objectives as per the Budget and Life of Province Plan through focus on duty of care, operational discipline, value creation and continuous improvement. Key accounatbilities and deliverables include:

Key accountabilities responsibilities and deliverables include:


Ensuring that mining, processing, maintenance and project engineering activities are undertaken safely and healthily in alignment with Newcrest expectations and in compliance with the prevailing health, safety and environment regulations.
Instilling a culture of excellence, accountability and discipline across maintenance, operations and engineering.
Championing and enabling with employee and business partner workforces within areas of accountability Newcrests four pillars of safety: Newsafe, Critical Control Management, Process Safety and Psychological Safety.
Setting and measuring performance expectations to instill a culture of operational excellence.
Instilling effective management practices, processes and a progressive culture across current and future operations and capital projects through the proactive identification and elimination of risks and hazards to realise the company vision of zero fatalities and life altering physical or psychological injuries.
Maintaining operational risk registers and protocols in alignment with company standards and expectations ensuing newly identified or developing risks are effectively recorded and mitigated.
Developing and owning incollaboration with the department leads the operational and maintenance budgets, life of province plan and supporting production schedules.
Effectively managing costs and quality within all areas of accountability to ensure that cost targets are met and surpassed and that quality of execution of all works meets the expected standards and is delivered to schedule.
Guiding, mentoring and assisting business partners in areas of accountability to safely and healthily execute their activities whilst respecting IBCA and environmental commitments to deliver outcomes that meet the expected standards, schedule and costs.
Ensuring a culture of continuous improvement in business processes, team and individual development and activity execution is enshrined in all areas of accountability in the pursuing of value add and efficiency.
Enabling Surface Mining operations to be executed safely and efficiently to schedule and design with focus on operator competencies, compliance to plan, effective and correct utilisation of equipment, rigorous setting and application of quality standards and expectations, minimising and evaluating the cause of unplanned production losses to eliminate repetition.
Delivering the Block Cave infrastructure to schedule and design through effective oversight and guidance to the team accountable for Underground Mining development activities and the associated contractors.
Realising Processing Operations operating time, throughput and recovery targets through progressively debottlenecking, automating and optimisating all elements of the plant.
Participating in process and metallurgical design studies to ensure that planned process plant expansions operable, maintainable and delivered to schedule and budget by the Block Cave project execution team.
Integration and alignment of Maintenance planning, reliability, condition monitoring and execution practices across fixed plant, mobile, electrical and site services to realise efficiencies and synergies.
Enabling and driving the transformation of Maintenance practices from reactive through planned to proactive to deliver high quality services and outcomes across all maintenance disciplines in terms of cost effectiveness, planning, execution and continuous improvement to realise and surpass target equipment availabilities.
Maintaining currency of Operational Technology deployed in the support of Mining and Processing operations to ensure that maximum benefits and efficiencies are realsied through effective application technological, communications and process control solutions whilst effectively managing the risks of obselecence.

Title: Operating Practices Specialist
Description:
Pay Range: $87,0009 - $118,257
Metrolinx is connecting communities across the Greater Golden Horseshoe. Metrolinx operates GO Transit and UP Express, as well as the PRESTO fare payment system. We are also building new and improved rapid transit, including GO Expansion, Light Rail Transit routes, and major expansions to Torontos subway system, to get people where they need to go, better, faster, and easier. Metrolinx is an agency of the Government of Ontario.
We embody our values in everything that we do. We Serve with Passion, Think Forward, and Play as a Team. If you can relate, we want to hear from you!
Our Rail Operations Office is seeking an Operating Practices Specialist to ensure Metrolinx rail operational compliance to rail safety, regulating bodies, and legislation through performing audits, developing, and conducting training, analysis, procedures, including briefing materials to meet ongoing business needs. In this role you will also partner with internal stakeholders to assist in conducting formal incident investigations, and receive and implement corrective recommendations.
What will I be doing?
Assist the Manager, to lead the department through the creation and implementation of all the necessary documentation to ensure that Metrolinx operates as a fully functioning railway with the highest standards of safety and competence prior to Project Co contract award.
Assist in the development of the first formal release of the Metrolinx Rail Rule Book with support from Transport Canada. You will be accountable for assisting in designing, updating, and tracking of all new material for the new manuals.
Work with stakeholders to oversee the process for auditing Rail Traffic Control (RTC), Engineering and Train Operating Crews.
Participate in the review, approval and issuing of system special instructions, educational bulletins and rules bulletins related to the Canadian Railway Operating Rules (CROR) from other stakeholders (Railways Association of Canada Notices, Olstom Notices, Rail Traffic Control Notices) for safe railway operation.
Through the direction of the Manager, work in close collaboration with adjoining railways such a CN Rail, CP Rail and VIA Rail Operating Practices groups for operational matters that ensure that risks specific to operations of the adjacent railways are appropriately mitigated by building strong working relationships.
Work with other operating practices team members as well as a cross-functional team (including NOCC and Operations and Engineering) to build competencies and ensure ongoing compliance with existing regulatory requirements and deliver a railway operations consultation documents/ submission for various new railway expansion projects.
Build collaborative relationships with all levels of organizational leadership and gains trust with stakeholders (e.g. customers, other business units, tenants, local transit) to foster good relations, gain support, develop resources, drive results, realize project outcomes, manage conflicts, and represent the needs of customers, stakeholders, operations, and maintenance.
Identify operational opportunities and work collaboratively with the operating practices team to introduce leading practices to improve processes by developing standards relating to the functional requirements for projects.
Collaboratively oversee the development of quality assurance metrics of contractor and supplier performance and review/approve corrective action plans for performance deficiencies.
Establish key performance indicators (KPI), monitoring systems, and reporting functionality and reviews.
In conjunction with the operating practices team, act as subject matter expert in providing consultation, advice and day-to-day guidance regarding functional requirements and processes.
Work with Senior Manager and Manager to provide creative leadership to develop and deploy a strategic vision for the delivery of operating practices processes and products and connects and aligns projects with strategic corporate goals.
Demonstrate leadership and core competencies at a high level of development and is an exemplary model of living the corporate Values and Code of Ethics.

Description:
Title: Interpreter
 Location: Various Sites - Deployable anywhere in Canada
 Employment Status: Temporary, Full Time - 2 months (ends June 30th)
 Salary Band: $25.16 -$36.69 /hour (according to province standard)


 An iconic brand and one of the most inspirational not-for-profit organizations on this planet  The Canadian Red Cross (CRC), is seeking an Interpreter.
 You have a passion for helping others, and want to work with other dedicated individuals? By applying, you are taking a big first step to be part of an exciting organization.
 At the Canadian Red Cross, we are guided by our fundamental principles of humanity, impartiality, neutrality, independence, voluntary service, unity and universality. We help people and communities in Canada and around the world in times of need and support them in strengthening their resilience.
 Starting with the hiring process, we are committed to having an accessible, diverse, inclusive and barrier-free work environment where everyone can reach their full potential. We encourage all qualified persons to apply, particularly Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, racialized people, and people with diverse gender identities and sexual orientations, and others who share our values and contribute to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.
 We are looking for an Interpreter to provide interpretation and airport reception services to individuals landing in Canada. Together with a team, you will support beneficiaries through interpretation from Ukrainian or Russian to English (and from English to Ukrainian or Russian). There will also be a requirement for some Interpreters to provide service from Ukrainian or Russian to French (and from French to Ukrainian or Russian).


 In this role, you will:

Provide reception services at Canadian International Airports to temporary residents from Ukraine based on daily flight arrival schedules 
Assist beneficiaries through interpretation in either Ukrainian or Russian to English or French 
Process information quickly and concisely in a professional and courteous manner 
Work collaboratively as part of a team of interpreter volunteers according to your schedule and availability 
Participate in preparation meetings, dry-run sessions, and potential training sessions. 
Understand and render conversations between Ukrainian or Russian and English or French speakers.


 
What we are looking for:

Proven language competency mandatory: fluency in Ukrainian or Russian to English or French combined with relevant interpretation experience in in-person and virtual settings. 
Neutrality and clarity: ability to convey ideas and concepts clearly taking cultural context into consideration while keeping a neutral posture. 
Customer service skills: ability to support beneficiaries and team members in compliance with our Humanity principle. 
Robust verbal and written communication skills are mandatory: attuned to supporting with active listening and the ability to explain and confirm understanding . 
Attention to detail: facility to identify nuances and non verbal clues when interpreting to adapt communication style. 
Technological proficiency: familiarity with digital communication channels is required (email, phone, videoconferencing, instant messaging...). 
Teamwork values: willingness to share information, help team members, respect diverse settings, stay approachable and create opportunities to build relationships. 
Mobility across Canada for potential in-person deployments


 
Working Conditions:

The majority of work will be performed in a fast-paced, changing environment with strict infection control practices, including the requirement to wear PPE. 
Must be able to work flexible hours and across a 7 day a week period/schedule. 
Full vaccination against COVID-19 is mandatory for this position and operation (the CRC will however adhere to its duty to accommodate those who are unable to be fully vaccinated for a reason related to a human right protected ground). 
Must be able to provide a Satisfactory Canadian Criminal Record Reference Check or an Enhanced Police Information Check.


 
If you require accommodation measures during any phase of the hiring process, please notify us as soon as possible. All information received in relation to accommodation requests will be kept confidential.

Description:
Who we are!

GREAT ENTERTAINMENT. GREAT PEOPLE. GREAT INVESTMENT. GREAT CANADIAN.

Since our inception in 1982, Great Canadian has grown to be one of the largest and most dynamic gaming and entertainment companies in Canada. With 25 properties across Ontario, British Columbia, Nova Scotia, and New Brunswick, our facilities include over 16,000 slot machines, 575 table games, 71 dining amenities and over 500 hotel rooms. Working closely alongside our crown agency partners, our team of 9,500 strive to offer the very best gaming, entertainment, dining, and hospitality experiences.

Our Vision is to be the leading gaming, entertainment, and hospitality company in our chosen markets by providing superior entertainment value and exceptional experiences.

Our Mission is to provide outstanding experiences to our guests, rewarding opportunities for our team, and superior value to our shareholders.


About this Role

Under the direction of the Director, Corporate Compliance & ERM, this position is responsible for managing the operational aspects of the iGaming AML Program for Great Canadian including: the research and development of Corporate iGaming AML policies and procedures; analysis of and reporting on audits and other monitoring activities conducted by internal and external auditors; ensuring internal policy and procedures related to AML operations comply with regulatory requirements; communications and issues management related to AML, Know Your Customer (KYC) program, special projects management; regulatory stakeholder liaison; and program evaluation for efficiency. Motivates and leads by example and provides a learning environment while establishing a safe and welcoming work environment for all employees.


What Youll Get to DO!
Manages all aspects of Great Canadians iGaming AML program
Manages all internal policy and procedures related to the iGaming AML program
Develops and monitors internal policies and procedures to ensure accuracy and compliance; liaises with senior management to identify, interpret and clarify AML issues and updates; drafts new or revised documentation as directed; distributes accordingly; identifies training opportunities
Liaises with all provincial and federal regulatory agencies as the primary operational contact for site audits; assists with investigations; prepares and distributes reports; follows up with sites to ensure procedural reconciliations
Responsible for completion and management of AML risk assessments and monitoring programs and ensuring these programs remain aligned and in compliance with statutory requirements
Provides ad hoc reporting to corporate gaming directors as requested (e.g., volume of FINTRAC reports)
Conducts, evaluates and responds to AML reviews and reports, FINTRAC issues, risk management, and audits
Responsible for managing and correcting issues of AML non-compliance as well as instituting policy to eliminate the lapse in regulatory compliance
Liaises and communicates with management and appropriate operational departments concerning AML issues
Develops AML training and conducts AML training sessions, when required
Reviews, creates and analyzes STRs (Suspicious Transaction Reports)
Communicates effectively with all appropriate corporate and operational departments
Develops and cultivates strong working relationships with all stakeholders: guests, employees, management, contractors, vendors and regulators
Complies with licensing laws, health and safety and other statutory regulations
Works with operational departments, provincial lottery corporations and regulators (as appropriate) to address, respond and manage incidents of fraud


What youll need to be Successful!
Post-secondary education or a suitable combination of education and related experience in AML, business administration, compliance, policy analysis, project management, program evaluation, data analysis, risk management or related fields
Minimum 3 years of experience in a Compliance role
Demonstrated experience acting in a compliance capacity in a fast paced, technically challenging and ever-changing environment.
A diverse set of compliance assurance skills to draw from, depending on the situation being addressed.
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Demonstrated ability to plan, manage and deliver program management
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills in a variety of complex situations.
Computer literacy in MS Office
Technical writing or experience drafting policy and procedure manuals an asset
Strong working knowledge of provincial gaming control laws and federal anti-money laundering laws; anti-money laundering and security certifications an asset
Gaming industry experience an asset


What's in it for you?
We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!
We provide you with the tools and technology needed to delight your clients!
You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top organizations around the world
Remote and Flexible work arrangements!
Freedom to Innovate: supports new and better ways to be successful
Be your Authentic Self: environment that values diversity as a source of strength

About the role
All progress begins with pioneers. At Rio Tinto, it begins with you.
We are looking for a Production Planner to ensure the optimal management of our Casting departments production and shipment operations, through coordination of production, shipping, and inventory of Rio Tinto Atlantic and related stakeholders. The Production Planner is the main link between the Casting operation team and the Sales and Marketing team and will be responsible for production planning, order management, and establishing the production forecast via Casthouse performance evaluation.
This role is a great opportunity for a self-driven leader, with aluminum processing experience, to grow their career in a role where they can make an impact.
We are an open, connected global team that includes some of the industrys best and brightest minds. We offer competitive, performance-focused remuneration and a wide range of benefits to reward your contribution. With a global reach, the opportunities to develop and grow your career are broad and exciting.
Reporting to the Central Planner & Cold Metal Outbound Team Leader and working a Monday to Friday schedule, you will be:
Working safely in accordance with Rio Tinto safety standards  actively leading, and engaging in safety initiatives promoting our Zero harm safety culture
Establishing the production plan and tracking production performance for sheet slab, small ingot and sow
Coordinating with the plant production team and planning supervisor
Coordinating shipping needs with carriers and with Operations, Planning and Commercial stakeholders
Solving problems of moderate complexity within your area of activity, considering the global business context
Interacting regularly with internal and/or external clients to ensure technical and quality requirements are met
Managing metal inventory to meet targets, including scrap management
Frequently interacting with customers to ensure Rio Tinto product meets on-time delivery and to identify potential improvement opportunities
Acting as the main liaison with external customers, Montreal Sales and Marketing office regarding sales plan & production forecast
What youll bring
A commitment to the safety of yourself and your team
Bachelors degree in Metallurgical or industrial engineering or other related training in production optimization and/or any other relevant planning experience

Demonstrated aptitude for planning and tracking of production performances

Ability to transfer knowledge easily
Coordination/planning expertise, analytical abilities, and a sense of interpretation (diagnostics)

      Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

      We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program

Title: Manager, Facilities and Procurement
Description:
Do you want to work for one of BCs Top Employers for 2022 and join an innovative, customer-centric organization? 
The Land Title and Survey Authority of British Columbia (LTSA) is looking to hire a Manager, Facilities and Procurement to join our Finance division in either our Victoria, Kamloops, or New Westminster, BC office! 
Who we are: The LTSA is a publicly accountable, statutory corporation that manages BC's land title and survey systems. These systems provide the foundation for all real property business and ownership in the province. 
We offer meaningful work in the public interest. In support of the Provinces 30-point housing plan, the LTSA built and launched the Condo and Strata Assignment Integrity Register as well as the Land Owner Transparency Registry, a first-of-its-kind registry. 
We offer an innovative, customer-centric culture. We are not your typical land title registrywe are focused on technology and innovation. We are a national and global leader in the effective automation of property registration and through technology, we are reducing turnaround time for our customers (e.g., lawyers, notaries, land surveyors, etc.) while also improving the consistency, accuracy and efficiency of our services. 
We believe in a hybrid of remote and in-office work and know you'll love our office as much as we do! Our employees can work either entirely in the office, or a hybrid of both remote and in-office. Therefore, applicants must currently live in British Columbia or have plans to relocate to British Columbia. 
What you'll do: Reporting to the Corporate Controller/Director of Finance, the Manager, Facilities and Procurement manages the spectrum of activities related to day-to-day operation of facilities within each LTSA office (Victoria, Kamloops, New Westminster, and Vancouver). 
This position is key in the development and management of capital and operating budgets that relate to office infrastructure and equipment, and the ongoing management of the organizations supply of products, equipment, and services. 
Key responsibilities include: 
Manage facilities leasing, provision of equipment, office/space planning, office security, and facility related insurance requirements.
Manage day-to-day facility related issues that may arise.
Manage facility design and planning as it relates to existing and potentially new office locations.
Oversee facility related contractors in conjunction with property managers.
Issue and manage General Service Agreements with contractors and vendors.
Manage the LTSA's supply chain management function, including overall procurement and purchase order functions.
Work closely with primary Division contacts within LTSA to ensure their procurement related requirements are delivered, both in terms of products and services.
Maintain close contact with colleagues within Corporate IT to assist in delivering products and services as required in a timely and cost-effective manner.
Manage performance of unionized direct report(s) with responsibility for all employment related decisions (e.g. staffing, training, labour relations, etc.).
Participate in the annual budget preparation process and manage the relevant budgets over the course of the fiscal year.
Recommend and implement business process improvements for office operations to meet projected service delivery and operational targets. 
We encourage you to apply if you have: Education and Experience 
Bachelors degree in business administration or related studies, supplemented by a minimum of 8+ years experience in business operations.
Effective project management skills to ensure ongoing projects are completed on schedule and within the budgeted parameters.
Experience working with a wide range of vendors and service providers, ensuring they provide products and services that meet or exceed the requirements of the organization and do so within the financial constraints as outlined. 
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities 
Ability to develop and implement operational policies in a unionized environment.
Demonstrated experience delivering operational solutions that consider the impacts of financial, stakeholder, and human resource constraints.
Strong financial management skills including handling of budgets and company resources.
Excellent interpersonal communication skills and ability to deal with sensitive and confidential information with tact and diplomacy.
A self-starter with excellent written and oral communication skills.
Demonstrated ability to set priorities within an environment of divergent objectives.
Strong leadership, initiative, conflict resolution and negotiation skills.
Ability to manage multiple high-visibility projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
Highly computer proficient and experienced with relevant software.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with a wide variety of individuals and groups, both inside and outside of the organization.
Problem solving skills utilizing flexibility, creativity and innovation.
Excellent analytic and conceptual thinking skills.
Able to travel between LTSA offices (Victoria, Kamloops, New Westminster, Vancouver) periodically based on business and project needs. 
We are committed to fostering a safe, respectful and inclusive workplace where all employees can share their diverse views, skills and backgrounds. Valuing employee diversity strengthens workplace trust and enhances our ability to innovate in service of our customers and partners. Our hiring practices reflect this and we are committed to ensuring that our workforce reflects where we live and work. Consider joining our team and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace. 
COVID-19 Vaccination Policy - To ensure the safety of our employees, all LTSA, LandSure and Autoprop employees must be fully vaccinated. New employees will be required to be fully vaccinated and may be required to provide proof of vaccination before the start of their employment. 
Please note applicants must be legally authorized to work in Canada.

Title: ILC Finance and Operations Manager
Description:
ILC Finance and Operations Manager 

Primary Purpose: The Manager is responsible to oversee the administrative operations of the ILC; administrative structure planning and implementation; prepare and maintain budgets while optimizing expenses; set administrative policies and processes for the ILC, ensure employees work productively and oversee recruitment and training of administrative employees; and a number of administrative activities within the ILC including space assignments and liaison with senior College executive and Usask SBAs 
Nature of Work: The Manager overall reports to the Dean, College of Law. The individual will work closely with the Director of Administration to ensure consistencies in operations. The impact of error is high, as only minimal direction provided. This position oversees the administrative and financial activities for the ILC. In addition to working with the Academic Director and College senior administration, this position provides leadership, direction and supervision to staff in the ILC. Working conditions require innovation and may be stressful given the high volume of work, complex problems, tight deadlines, and the need for accuracy. Considerable discretion is required as this position is privy to and works with sensitive, highly confidential information. This position can expect long and sometimes irregular hours.
Accountabilites: 

Develop and maintain effective collaborative and professional working relationships and partnerships with faculty, staff, students and community partners external to the College.
 In collaboration with the Academic Director, college administration and SBAs, develop and implement administrative and financial strategic plans, policies and procedures for the ILC
 Support and contribute positively to changes in support of the ILCs goals. 
Effectively use resources (fiscal, people, information technology, etc.) to meet the strategic goals of the ILC and identify/recommend strategies for process improvements. 
Provide feedback and assistance to the Academic Director and senior college administration in the identification and development of appropriate financial and administration solutions to operational issues.

Financial 

Prepare effective short and long-term budget planning for the ILC. 
Work collaboratively with the Academic Director and college administrative team to allocate funds appropriately to ensure the ILCs strategic priorities are developed and executed. 
Manage the financial activities for the ILC including budget process, research funding, donor funding, and financial risk.
 Provide timely, open and accurate financial reporting and analysis that supports informed operational and development decisions. 
Develop and implement innovative and creative solutions to resource challenges within the ILC.
 Work closely with the Colleges administrative team, SBAs and the Financial Services Division to ensure the ILCs finances are in line with the financial direction for the University. 

Human Resources 

Work collaboratively with the College administration and HR SBAs on human resource matters
 Effectively implement and manage staff complement plans including recruiting and leading a high performing, motivated and committed professional and support staff complement. 
Directly supervise administrative staff in the ILC
 Provide effective coaching, mentoring and development planning to staff to ensure their success.
 Implement and stay current with best practices in human resources. 
Ensure staff are held accountable for high standards of performance and outcomes and that individuals are delivering outcomes aligned with the vision and direction of the ILC, College and University. 
Ensure performance concerns are effectively addressed in a timely manner and that corrective measures and disciplinary action, up to and including termination, are taken as appropriate. 
Model a high standard of performance and outcomes. 

Risk Management 

Develop and promote a culture of responsible risk taking for the ILC. 
Identify, assess, and manage risks for the ILC while ensuring accountability and transparency of the ILC activities. 
Implement and maintain an effective system of checks and balances with respect to financial management and assets including general safeguarding and stewardship of all resources in the ILC.

Qualifications  Education and Experience: The successful candidate will hold a university degree in Finance, Human Resources or Business Management. A combination of education and experience would be considered. He or she must have a minimum of 7-10 years of related experience in finance, along with 3-5 years experience in human resources and managing a unit. The successful candidate must possess strong leadership attributes and have solid experience in progressively more responsible positions. An individual with experience in contract administration, university policies and procedures and a demonstrated understanding and application of best practices would be considered an asset.
Skills: Proven track record in working collaboratively as a member of a team; strong communication skills, both written and verbal; demonstrable analytical and organizational skills; proven ability to create and manage financial budgets; ability to effectively work with decision makers to achieve solutions to unique and complex problems; ability to maneuver through complex political situations; ability to negotiate effectively in difficult situations; sound judgment; ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive matters diplomatically and discreetly; demonstrated competency in the areas of leadership/vision, support for progress, results orientation, personal effectiveness, communication, and relationship building; and proficient computer skills, particularly with Microsoft Office applications.

Title: PCAS22 - 058 - Analyst, Data Intelligence (2 Year Contract)

Assesses data-related issues and develops resolutions to meet department and agency objectives.5. Conducts key informant interviews, focus groups, file reviews and surveys.9. Creates ad-hoc reports and analytical products as requested in a timely and accurate manner, assists with various tasks and items as needed.10. Works with personnel from other departments as necessary to efficiently and effectively summarize and present data to fulfill customer requirements.11. Support the Manager, Client Services & Support in preparing annual and ad-hoc reports, program evaluation using Client Service Application (CSapp)12. Support the Business Information and Innovation team in the design, development and testing of BI solutions while providing recommendations to increase efficiencies and achieve best practice standards.13. Assists with business process reviews when employing the appropriate techniques and standards for analyzing, mapping and validating business processes.14. Supports collection, analysis and dissemination of reports on OnLAC AAR information and client feedback data.15. Contributes to the research reviews and evaluation activities of the agency including the design and implementation of research projects.16. Other duties as assigned. 
JOB SPECIFICATIONS/COMPETENCIES 
Demonstrated expertise in use of quantitative and qualitative analytical methods that support performance assessment, comprehensive knowledge of program evaluation methodologies and quality/process improvement tools.

Title: Technical Business Analyst (II)-Human Resources
Description:
Fleming is located in the heart of the Kawartha Lakes Region in Central Ontario... a beautiful place to live and work, surrounded by natural beauty and a mere 90 minutes north-east of Toronto. The Colleges 6,800 full-time and 10,000 part-time students, including hundreds of international students from countries around the world, attend at campus locations in Peterborough, Lindsay, Haliburton and Cobourg. Fleming offers more than 100 full-time programs in Environmental and Natural Resource Sciences, Fine Arts, General Arts and Science, Technology, Skilled Trades, Community Development, Health, Business, and Justice as well as other Continuing Education courses.
 We are also extremely proud of our more than 73,000 Fleming alumni who are contributing to their communities in the region, across the province and around the world.





 What Are We About?





Please Note: This is a temporary, full time contract, starting immediately for a minimum of 3 months with the possibility of extension
 We are seeking someone who can jump right into this vital role.
 This key role provides business analysis and solutions in the development, maintenance and enhancement of all Peoplesoft processes for Human Resources and Payroll systems and related business functionality (e.g. bolt-on applications; third-party software) within Human Resources. In this position you will work with HR and Payroll end-users, Information Technology staff, vendor representatives and College leaders to gather functional information and translate it into detailed business requirements, functional specifications, test plans, end-user training materials, and procedural documentation.
 There are three main aspects to this role 
 One, this position plays a pivotal role in introducing new functions and features in the HR system. We use many of the PeopleSoft HR modules (Human Resources, Payroll, Time & Labour, Absence, Recruiting and Learning) and are seeking to take better advantage of the systems capabilities. You would be expected to learn the current business process, configure the system to best suit our needs, train appropriate users and support the system once rolled out.
 Two, as an HR organization, we are constantly relied upon to provide accurate data and business analytics for both operational and strategic business needs. You would develop a portfolio of reports to provide to the Colleges users or to external parties. You would respond to the request, understand the users requirements, develop the report and then deploy it to the requestor.
 Three, you would provide operational support to the team on the HR system. This could involve day-to-day troubleshooting of unexpected problems, reacting to government-legislated or collective agreement changes or keeping our system up-to-date with respect to maintenance levels. This could range from diagnosing and solving a problem in 30 minutes or testing a PeopleSoft enhancement over for longer periods of time. 
This position has been designated as hybrid/partially remote and is expected to be on-site 50% of the time
 For More Information For a complete job description, please refer to the document found here: Job Description
 Explore what Fleming College has to offer and the beautiful communities we are surrounded by. Check out Life@Fleming.  What We Are Looking For: Reporting to the Director, Employee Experience, you love to apply technology to business problems. You are naturally inquisitive and constantly asking questions about why things work the way they do. You are the type of person who would gladly assist someone with whatever problem they have. You have the ability to translate functional requirements into technical solutions, and work well with IT teams to help them understand what we need, and collaborate with them to produce innovative designs and then test the solution that they have produced.
 You have a 3-year diploma or degree in Computer Science or related field. You have a minimum of five (5) years of recent work experience in any combination of the following:


Functional experience with Enterprise Resource Planning software, specifically PeopleSoft
Advanced knowledge of database reporting tools
Project management
Requirements definition and translation into solutions
Functional testing
Troubleshooting system problems

 In addition, you will possess excellent communication skills (oral and written) and interpersonal skills which allow you to work effectively in a fast-paced, customer-service focused team amid critical deadlines, multiple projects and competing priorities.
 This is an opportunity to bring your unique skills to the Human Resources department, while at the same time challenging yourself along the way. If you see yourself in this role, we welcome your application!

If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary . City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance, promote physical and psychological safety, and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits . Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life.
            





            The City is committed to fostering a respectful, inclusive and equitable workplace which is representative of the community we serve. We welcome those who have demonstrated a commitment to upholding the values of equity, diversity, inclusion, anti-racism and reconciliation. Applications are encouraged from members of groups that are historically disadvantaged and underrepresented. Accommodations are available during the hiring process, upon request. 
          









          As a Planner 2, you will work collaboratively with colleagues and stakeholders to maintain, update, interpret and modernize the land use bylaw so that it aligns with the evolving needs of the city, supports efficient and effective planning processes, and implements Councils policies and priorities. You contribute to achieving the priorities of the city planning and policy service line to implement the Municipal Development Plan; supporting modernized community planning and transit oriented development, exploring how to enable more housing choice in Calgarys established communities; and contributing to corporate initiatives and legislative requirements. Primary duties include:
         




           Conduct research and analysis, and make recommendations for land use bylaw amendments.
           


           Prepare, write and present recommendations for land use bylaw amendments and other planning issues to various City Commissions, Committees and Council.
           


           Provide research and gap analysis to investigate and maintain compliance of The Citys land use bylaw with The Citys long term visionary plans such as the Municipal Development Plan.
           


           Explain complex land use bylaw and development issues to public, development industry, community and professional associations and elected officials.
           


           Liaise with all stakeholders for policy developments and bylaw amendments.
           


           Consider new trends with bylaw rules and implementation.
           


           Advise and respond to inquiries from Council, management and the general public with respect to land use bylaw and other planning issues in a timely manner.
           









Qualifications
 





          A degree in Planning that is recognized by the Canadian Institute of Planners (CIP) and at least 3 years of relevant planning experience; OR
          


          A degree in a planning related discipline, such as Landscape Architecture or Architecture, and at least 4 years of relevant planning experience.
          


          Experience in land use bylaw review, writing regulations, and planning policy development.
          


          Previous experience with implementing Calgary Land Use Bylaw is an asset.
          


          Skills with Sketch-up, Adobe Creative Suite, or similar applications is an asset.
          


          Previous experience planning and facilitating public engagement with an equity focus, is an asset. 
         


          Success in this role requires:
         



            Demonstrated knowledge of planning principles and legislation, sound planning analysis and the application of strong judgment skills.
            


            Strategic and analytical thinker with the ability to facilitate conflict resolution.
            


            Effective communication skills, with a focus on customer service and collaboration.
            


            Ability to build strategic working relationships in a political environment.
            



          Demonstrate and integrate City values to achieve individual and team objectives.

Title: Assistant Manager (Part-time)
Description:
WHO WE ARE:
 At Landmark Cinemas, we are the Cast & Crew of Canadas second largest motion picture, theatre exhibition company, and WE love movies as much as YOU love movies. But its more than just a movie. Thats why our Cast & Crew are valuable and why we are always focused on creating an exceptional movie experience for our Guests; why the quality of our popcorn matters and why a perfect presentation is understood. Every detail is important to us, which is why we think like owners and remain steadfast in accomplishing our goals. Its why we opened our first theatre in 1965, and why well continue making the movie experience the best that it can be. 


People are at the core of our business - we are for ALL Movie Lovers and this means we embrace a culture of inclusion and mutual respect by valuing the uniqueness of all Cast & Crew, Guests, and business partners. We value respectful behavior above individual achievements, and we are committed to having our workforce reflect the communities we serve.

 We are proud to support Kids Help Phone. As a National Sponsor of Walk So Kids Can Talk, Landmark Cinemas is committed to supporting the mental health and well-being of young Movie Lovers, including our Cast & Crew.

 WHO YOU ARE:
 You are an all-star team motivator that has experience leading by example and directing the Cast and Crew in delivering the ultimate movie-going experience by radiating our Company Values and applying policies and procedures. You understand what it takes to provide exceptional Guest Service and are energized by communicating with others. In supporting the Theatre Management Team, you will demonstrate many accountabilities, and enjoy having fun and encouraging a work environment that maintains team focus and demonstrates results... and YOU love movies!

 THE JOB:

 Manage daily operations of the theatre complex (Including: labour cost, cost of sales, revenue control, speed of service, Guest satisfaction, equipment & procedure training, safety of Guests & Cast, and film & product quality)
 Assist with the execution of operational policies and procedures. Ensure that internal controls within the complex are in place, routinely evaluated, and followed
 Assist with the selection, training & development, and employment experience of the Cast
 Assist with the administration and operation of all pertinent systems (POS, audit documentation, training programs & projection)
 Communicate on an ongoing basis with the management team, including the General Manager, by attending all schedule meetings and by use of the communication tools provided
 Communicate and respond to outside resources including Emergency Service personnel, Cinema Support Centre personnel, Operational leaders, Suppliers, Contractors, and Community Groups to identify and resolve daily operational issues or concerns, as needed
 Keep abreast of industry and facility related information to ensure current and up-to-date operations of the complex
 Assist with the monitoring of Guest satisfaction; determine opportunities to enhance the movie-going experience and respond appropriately to challenges or obstacles that reduce positive Guest interaction
 Greet and engage Guests and make them feel special - helping to create memorable experience
 Be available and visible to Cast and Guests; observe and assist with potential issues
 Provide consistent performance feedback to Cast members and address performance issues in a timely manner using effective performance management tools
 Work safely and ensure Cast members are made aware of and follow safe work practices. Be prepared to respond in the event of an emergency, as required, including the coordination of Guest evacuation


 THE PERKS:

 This position offers a $2 premium on the provincial minimum wage
 Stay in the know on the latest Hollywood blockbusters with FREE movies
 Discounted popcorn and concession snacks...need we say more?
 Flexible scheduling options that work with your busy life
 Work with your friends in an engaging environment
 Opportunities for advancement in theater management

 REQUIREMENTS

 Minimum 1 year experience motivating and managing a dynamic team to achieve positive results in a timely manner
 Proven track record in a leadership role within a fast-paced environment
 Commitment to excellence in Guest service with proven ability to maintain significant attention to detail
 An individual who sets actionable goals, takes the initiative to deliver, and shows persistence in problem-solving while keeping others focused on results
 Proficiency with food production, revenue control procedures, and related systems would be considered to be an asset
 Prior experience with projection or audio-visual equipment an asset
 Excellent written, verbal, and listening communication skills and proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite

 A subsidiary of Kinepolis Group NV, Belgium, Landmark is Canadas second largest motion picture, theatre exhibition company. From a single screen in 1965, today Landmark Cinemas welcomes Movie Lovers to share their love of movies and enjoy a perfect movie-going experience in 46 cinemas and 334 screens throughout Western Canada, Ontario and the Yukon Territory. We are connected to the communities we serve, and our Cast and Crew are proud to support Kids Help Phone. As a National Sponsor of the Walk So Kids Can Talk, through promotional support and fundraising initiatives in our theatres, we are committed to support the mental health and well-being of both our youth Guests and Cast & Crew. Landmarks corporate headquarters is in Calgary, Alberta.

 If you require assistance or an alternative accessible format, due to a disability, in accessing or completing any aspect of the application process, please contact Human Resources at accessibility@landmarkcinemas.com.

Position Information 
   





Position Title


       Business Development Consultant
      




Position Summary



        As a member of the Extended Education team, the Business Development Consultant works with the Dean, Extended Education and other senior leadership colleagues to establish new relationships with external clients, to enable an organizational culture of life-long learning, training and development within a learning-centered environment.
       

 Reporting to, and in partnership with the Dean, Extended Education, the Business Development Consultant will be directly accountable for all aspects of prospect management, including but not limited to: prospect identification, qualification, cultivation, solicitation and stewardship while achieving strategic and financial targets by creating and/or growing new business from clients across a spectrum of revenue-generating sources at Red Deer Polytechnic (RDP).
       

         This position is primarily responsible for proactively generating demand by building a pipeline of qualified prospects, negotiating contracts, closing contracts, managing forecasts to achieve a specified individual sales target, ongoing stewardship of clients within the assigned portfolio(s), as well as critical decision making related to relationship management for RDP, corporate training solutions, revenue augmentation of grant applications, service engagements, and other ancillary revenue. The secondary responsibility is to identify opportunities for external stakeholders to engage with internal departments/schools at RDP in a manner that brings mutual benefit to all parties.
       

 The Business Development Consultant requires a high level of competencies in business development, strategic thinking, account management, and sales. To be successful in delivering on these responsibilities, the incumbent must have in-depth knowledge and connectivity within Extended Education, life-long-learning and customized training. They are expected to keep abreast with industry and market trends both through networking and research efforts. This position handles multiple responsibilities, solves complex problems, and is open to constant challenge and change. The incumbent develops and maintains positive working relationships with a variety of contacts inside and outside the Institution. This position requires a high degree of initiative, independence of action, flexible work times, and the ability to achieve results without explicit guidance.
       





Position Responsibilities



External Relationships  Opportunity Creation  Sales


Responsible for the identification and development of new contracts related to corporate training solutions, revenue augmentation of grant applications, service engagements, and other ancillary revenue with qualified clients and/or sponsors, including the achievement of gross and net revenue targets.
Create demand for the Division of Extended Education programs and training solutions by developing a strong network of client users.
In collaboration with the Promotions Coordinator, develop and implement marketing strategies to enhance RDP in the marketplace and expand our reputation as a leader in corporate training and business solutions.
Accountable for the creation of proposals and contracts, their accuracy, completeness of information, and adherence to the Institutions margins and policies.
Responsible for representing RDP in negotiating, developing, and presenting (or approving within authorized limits) contracts with clients, businesses, professional associations, and government agencies.
Responsible for making decisions regarding potential clients and ongoing relationships related to organizational alignments that affect the profile of RDP and the Division of Extended Education.
Establish and maintain long-term relationships with business partners, clients, academic partnerships, and other stakeholders.

Ensure that RDP maintains an image for quality training and services through professional, ethical conduct and high-level customer satisfaction.
Implement an annual sales plan to achieve gross revenue and net contribution targets set by the Dean, Extended Education





Operational Excellence and Continuous Improvement


Develop annual sales targets and operational expenses for corporate training and solutions under the direction of the Dean, Extended Education and in collaboration with Business Development Coordinator.
Liaise with Dean, Extended Education in establishing strategies and KPIs for the Division and aligning corporate solutions sales strategy with overall divisional/institution goals.

Develop a high performing relationship with the Business Development Coordinator to modify and improve the sales and development cycle of corporate training solutions.
Successfully hand-off signed corporate training and solution contracts to the Business Development Coordinator for development and program delivery.

Collaborate with Deans Council members, the Partnerships and Advancement team to fully leverage Red Deer Polytechnics ability to provide total revenue solutions.
Work closely with the Extended Education team members responsible for training delivery to ensure contract commitments with external stakeholders are fulfilled as agreed.
Engage with Deans Council members and Partnerships and Advancement team members responsible for internal relationships to understand how schools and departments can bring value to external clients.
Collaborate with appropriate departments and schools within the Institution to increase partnership opportunities with individuals, businesses and industry

Demonstrates compliance with Occupational Health and Safety responsibilities and the protection of personal privacy through the FOIP policy.
Builds a strong understanding of industry trends in the portfolios managed and held accountable for.
Acquires and maintains best practices in business development methodology and execution.
Provides mentorship and support to members of Extended Education team.

Title: Parks Staffing Administrator
Description:
If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary . City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance, promote physical and psychological safety, and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits . Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life.

The City is committed to fostering a respectful, inclusive and equitable workplace which is representative of the community we serve. We welcome those who have demonstrated a commitment to upholding the values of equity, diversity, inclusion, anti-racism and reconciliation. Applications are encouraged from members of groups that are historically disadvantaged and underrepresented. Accommodations are available during the hiring process, upon request.

As a Parks Staffing Administrator, you will provide support for the Workforce Management Office using high attention to detail to track, document and update records in compliance with collective agreement rules as well as corporate policy and procedures. These reports are used to determine staffing assignments, recall information, layoff order and shift preference in conjunction with the Workforce Management Lead on behalf of Parks Operations. Primary duties include:
Build and update multiple complex tracking sheets, verify and cross check information from various sources to ensure documentation records are correct.
Ensure adherence to union agreements, city policies and procedures as it pertains to the Parks Staffing Office.
Records management in accordance of City policy, of official records and transitory documents (electronic and hard copy files) including auditing of files/information.
Update seniority documentation in various documentation reflective of cross-checking multiple reports and verifying information.
Internal recruitment documentation, screening and tracking of applications, scheduling, creating of draft postings and interview guides for both the Lead and hiring manager(s).
Support the Workforce Management Lead to successfully manage the administration of recall and hire for approximately 300-500 Seasonal staff.
Facilitate Layoff process of seasonal staff including creating layoff letters, liaising with leaders on needs, confirming numbers and updating the Lead as required.
Take meeting minutes documenting action items and decision points.
Create or update communication material and documentation of procedures and/or process within the staffing office, including maintaining and updating manuals and employee handbooks.
Liaise with Subject Matter Experts to ensure documentation is reflective of current processes or policy.
Creating metrics, reports and analyzing data.
Liaise and respond to questions from Parks leaders or employees as it pertains to recall, layoff, or recruitment activities.
Provide administrative support in areas such as updating contact lists, mail/courier distribution, catering and facility bookings, purchasing supplies.
Qualifications
A completed 1 year Human Resources certificate, or 1 year Administrative Assistant certificate or a closely related field is required.
At least 2 years of related experience as outlined above in recruitment, HR function or administrative assistant role.
A valid Class 5 Driver's License (or provincial equivalent) and the use of a personal vehicle for work to access remote work sites is required.
Intermediate proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word and PowerPoint) is required.
Applicants with previous experience working and supporting a unionized environment and understanding collective agreements will be considered an asset. Experience in parks or landscape maintenance, construction, or labour industry will also be considered an asset.
Competencies for this position include attention to detail, customer focus, excellent communication skills, and strong planning and organizing skills. The successful candidate will have the ability to multi task while maintaining accuracy and determine strategies for competing priorities.

Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.

Join Our Team
  

    Join our dynamic, diverse team at Four Seasons Resort & Residences Whistler as the Security Officer
  


    Our work environment pairs a strong commitment to excellent service and authentic experiences with an emphasis on creativity and innovation. We are looking for someone with excitement and dedication in serving our guests. Satisfying our guests depends on the united efforts of many, we are most effective when we work together cooperatively, respecting each others contribution and importance.
  


    The Location
  

    Be ready for a warm Canadian experience! At Four Seasons Resort Whistler, we fill guests days with exhilarating adventures on Whistler and Blackcomb mountains and Employee days with happiness and thrilling working experience. We aim not only to be the best Resort to stay in Canada but also the greatest place to work! We offer 273 newly refurbished elegant guest rooms and suites; a luxury Spa and a top rated

    Our guest rooms are spacious, beautifully re-styled in December, 2019, the refurbished rooms and suites pay close attention to the unique placement of Whistler  a secluded retreat, just an hour and a half away from the international destination of Vancouver.
  


    In December 2020, we completed a property-wide enhancement with the launch of Braidwood Tavern, a craft kitchen and social house conceived in collaboration with celebrated chef and restauranteur Richard Sandoval, along with a re-imagined SIDECUT Steakhouse, both designed by Box Interior Design.
  


    Your job:
  

    The role of the Security Officer involves:
  

 The Security Officer is a vital member of the Security Team who is responsible for providing a safe and secure environment for employees, guests and residents
 Participates in the day-to-day security operations of the property to ensure the safety and security of all personnel, guests, residents and property.
 Patrol the property on a daily basis and check for any damage or any incidents and submit reports to the Management.
 Monitor CCTV and ensure all cameras are recording and working properly.
 Assist guests and residents with key assist, door assist and safe assist.
 Skilled problem solver with a high attention to detail and a high sense of ethics and honesty.
 Ensure that Fire Exit doors are always locked and kept free of blockage at all times
 Perform all tasks consistently in line with the Four Seasons standards and adhere to all legal and statutory requirements and adheres to the provisions outlined in the Employee Handbook, Disciplinary/Code of Business Conduct and Ethics and Rules & Regulations;
 Maintains effective communication with all resort departments to ensure smooth service delivery;
 Ensures that fellow colleagues follow safety rules and use friendly approach to help eradicate an unsafe work practice.
 Maintains a favorable working relationship with all resort employees to foster and promote a cooperative and harmonious working climate;
 To demonstrate pride in the workplace and personal appearance at all times when representing the resort, therefore identifying a high level of commitment.
 To promote efficiency, confidence, courtesy and an extremely high standard of social skills;
 To report any equipment failures/problems and pass any maintenance requests to the Security department;
 To assist and comply with any reasonable request made by the management to the best of your ability;
 Attend regular Training on Front Office techniques and operating systems and participate in any Training / Development schemes as recommended by senior Management;
 Performs all duties and responsibilities in a timely and efficient manner in accordance with established security Policies & Procedures to achieve the overall objectives of this position;
 Communicates promptly and efficiently guest complaints and compliments to the Management;
 First Aid level I
 Keeps the Security Manager promptly informed of all problems or unusual matters of significance;



    As our hotel is open 24/7, 365 days a year, we expect our Security Officer to be flexible in working mornings, evenings, weekends, and holidays.
  


    About You:
  

    Candidates must have a knowledge of Security operations and emergency and safety procedures
  

    Must have a minimum of 1 year of experience in a similar role in hospitality or loss prevention domain.
  

    Fluent English (written, spoken and reading). First Aid Level II, Security Guard Certification.
  

    Hotel computer systems knowledge.
  

    Experienced in CPR, first aid, firefighting and crowd control
  

    Ability to work in Canada

    Four Seasons is dedicated to perfecting the travel experience through continual innovation and the highest standards of hospitality. The deeply instilled Four Seasons culture is personified by its employees  people who share a single focus and are inspired to offer great service.

 About Us


 The Provincial Archives of Alberta (PAA) preserves the collective memory of Alberta and contributes to the protection of Albertans' rights and sense of identity. The Provincial Archives of Alberta holds over 58,000 linear meters of government textual records; over 5000 linear meters of private textual records; over 159,000 maps, plans and drawings; over 2.2 million photographic images; over 81,000 audiovisual records such as film, video and audio recordings; and, over 15,000 resource library books.






 Role


 In the Photographic Technician role, you will use your technical skills and expertise to manage and track the photo orders and reproduction services, complete public orders, and participate in outreach opportunities. Your technical expertise and knowledge of scanners and printers will be instrumental when you duplicate archival holdings on digital equipment.


You will be responsible for:

Providing photo reproduction services and preservation services according to Provincial Archives of Alberta policies, procedures and operational requirements.
Completing public order services using digital processes within established timelines established by the Provincial Archives.
Preserving photographs and negatives by implementing standards based on the Provincial Archives of Albertas strategic preservation plan and associated procedures.
Providing photographic support for Provincial Archives programs and outreach activities.
Ensuring that necessary supplies are stocked to complete public orders and preservation work.
The position reports directly to the Director of Access and Conservation Services to clarify assignments and resolve issues that arise in the course of fulfilling work responsibilities, takes direction on preservation activities from the Audiovisual Conservator, and interacts occasionally with the Textual Conservator.


 
The position must also interact frequently with various archivists (Reference Archivists, Government Records Archivists, and Private Records Archivists) and other staff (Archives Retail Services Coordinator) at the PAA to discuss assignments and complete work tasks.


The position interacts with the Program and Volunteer Coordinator and other PAA staff to provide visual content pertaining to public programs, promotional material, and social media.


The position interacts with the public to discuss requirements and issues pertaining to requests for reproductions of archival records.

 Two-year technical school diploma in a related field plus two years related experience; or equivalent as described below.


Equivalency: Directly related education or experience considered on the basis of: 1 year of education for 1 year of experience; or 1 year of experience for 1 year of education.


Experience in working in an office environment, and interacting with the public is required. Attention to detail and a team player with good organizational skills are also essential. Must be proficient in the use of Microsoft Office tools in an office environment.

Our team of 43,000 staff, medical staff and volunteers is dedicated to serving our patients, families and communities to deliver on our vision: Better health, best in health care.

 Participates in the redesign and restructuring of operational systems, strategies and processes such as designing space allocation that meet strategic and operational service plans that achieve maximum efficiency and quality while improving overall service delivery.

Provides leadership & coordination to projects that impact site operations and patient care (i.e. Emergency Management Projects, Phone downtimes, Helipad downtime) through communication and review to ensure site operations integrity is not compromised.

Participates in the redesign and restructuring of operational systems, strategies and processes such as designing space allocation that meet strategic and operational service plans that achieve maximum efficiency and quality while improving overall service delivery.

Monitors expenditures within approved established budget and identifies efficiencies and promotes optimal use of resources. Makes recommendations on current and future programs and service adjustments from site perspective.


Participates in the development and implementation of multi-disciplinary quality improvement processes; ensures the coordination of services and programs to reduce gaps in service, duplication of service and that the right interface is in place to support excellence in customer service.


Ensures that appropriate quality and safety measures are in place and compatible with industry standards and accreditation bodies; notifies appropriate regional disciplines to any breach in compliance.


Promotes and facilitates excellence in communication with internal and external contacts and clients, in keeping with customer service philosophy, mission statement and good business practices; responds to and resolves customer service problems; promotes customer involvement in making recommendations.


Co-ordinates the renovation process of design development and contract preparation by liaising with Facility Planning project consultants and various User Groups for assigned projects.


Prepares site project feasibility studies for small jobs, including documenting functional programs and total project cost estimates. With guidance from Facility Planning, ensures that working drawings are consistent with the project scope.


Monitors facility service levels and co-chairs related site based committees (i.e. housekeeping, linen, FMO, IMIT, Space Utilization, Wellness) for contracted service and internally delivered services to ensure service excellence and operational standards are met at all times; works with support service managers and contract managers to ensure timely compliance to service issues that do not maintain or strengthen a customer service focus.

Monitors lease space, room rentals and identifies needs; prepares proposals for improvements/new purchases.


Participates on various hospital committees, teams and task groups.

Title: Youth Support Worker | Weekends
Description:
In order to be hired at Covenant House Vancouver as an employee, practicum student, or volunteer, candidates must provide evidence of full courses of Health-Canada approved vaccinations prior to starting their first shift.
About Covenant House Vancouver
Since 1997, Covenant House Vancouver has provided relentless support for youth experiencing, or at-risk of experiencing, homelessness. We provide support to young people age 16 to 24 who have experienced a wide range of early life and ongoing, complex trauma; including physical, sexual and emotional abuse and neglect. Our purpose is to serve all youth, with absolute respect and unconditional love, to help youth experiencing homelessness, and provide a safe and supportive environment for all youth in need.
The Impact a Youth Support Worker can make:

As a Youth Support Worker you will be responsible for the direct implementation of Covenant House Vancouvers philosophy, policies and principles as they pertain to client care and safety to all. Your primary role is to build rapport with youth, assist with tasks, and help ensure safety on shift.


How you will contribute:
Ensure adherence to and role model Covenant House principles and core values
Greet and welcome youth accessing CHV services, assess and respond to their immediate needs, and provide them with practical resources including food, clothing, transportation, etc
Build rapport with at risk youth 16-24 years of age
Support youth with nightly routines
Respond to any emergency situations that may arise, by implementing procedures outlined in various staff training, including Emergency response training (fire, etc), First Aid, Managing Hostile Interactions, and Non-Violent Crisis Intervention, etc.
Read and review all pertinent information and communication (i.e. Incident reports, communications logs, policies, procedures, emails, etc)
Attend all training as directed by your manager
Maintain the cleanliness and safety of the program areas  both staff and youth
Clean, search, and remake resident rooms at discharge
Laundry as needed
Front Desk and reception duties as required
Meet operational needs as required and ensure the safety of building and occupants, including fire, safety, and emergency procedures
Other duties as required


Who we are looking for?
Education and Experience:
One to Two years post secondary education, or equivalent
First Aid & Non-Violent Crisis Intervention is an asset
Skills & Abilities:
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Familiar with the challenges facing youth who are experiencing homelessness or housing instability
Familiarity with substance misuse and mental health concerns
Strong administrative skills


Why Work for us? Would you like to 
Be part of a team that makes a difference to the lives of young people in need
Have a generous Health & Dental Benefits, including a health spending account, generous counselling benefits, and employee assistance program, great vacation and personal leave
Access ongoing training and development to improve both professional and personal growth
Attend an array of exciting team bonding exercises throughout the year
An inclusive team that welcomes new ideas and creativity


Additional Information
Schedule: Friday-Sunday: Alternating 2 weeks days (8am  4pm), 2 weeks evenings (4pm  12am)
Benefits: Full Benefits after 3 months of employment
Department: Community Support Services

Diversity, Equity & Inclusion
Covenant House Vancouver is a secular organization that welcomes and serves young people from all backgrounds. While the international federation to which we belong was founded in the 1970s by members of the Catholic Church, we are not aligned with any specific faith traditions.
CHV is committed to upholding diversity, equity, and inclusion in our workplace. We actively encourage applications from members of groups with historical and/or current barriers to equity, including, but not limited to:
Persons from groups marginalized due to race, ancestry, colour, religion/spiritual beliefs, or place of origin;
Persons with visible (physical) and/or invisible (mental) disabilities;
Persons who identify as women;
Persons of marginalized sexual orientations, gender identities, and gender expressions; and
Indigenous persons.
We recognize that many of these identities intersect and that therefore, diversity, equity, and inclusion can be complex. We value the contributions that each person brings and are committed to ensuring full and equal participation for all at Covenant House Vancouver.
We love what we do and try to make a difference every day. Covenant House Vancouver offers a competitive salary with a great benefits package and excellent opportunity for training and career advancement. If you are looking to join a place where we have a purpose and aim to achieve positive outcomes, please join us by applying.
